channel.title: Cooking on Shawnee Skogen
channel.description: Recent content in Cooking on Shawnee Skogen

item.title: Annual Lefse Making Meeting November 15, 2020
item.description: Every year we make lefse, Lefse is a traditional soft Norwegian flatbread. It is made with potatoes (often, but not always), flour, butter, and milk or cream. It is cooked on a large, flat griddle. Special tools are used to prepare lefse, including long wooden turning sticks and special rolling pins with deep grooves. It’s almost like a flour tortilla but softer and tastier and Norwegian! Consider joining our lodge so you can learn to make lefse and all sorts of other Scandinavian art, food, etc.
